name: Coco Wallet
headline: Web3 super app for remittances to Latin America.
description: Send, spend, save, and earn money via stablecoins.

founders.name: Victor Charles, Co-Founder
founders.description:
Just a Venezuelan dude building and shipping crypto products with real life uses cases since 2014.

YC Badge: 0x76d772b9e5dd1b50e416ae31a7a62735ecea3fc4

generated_description:
Coco Wallet is a New York-based company that's redefining how remittances work for Latin America through its innovative Web3 super app. Founded in 2019 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S19, the company has rapidly grown to a team of 50 employees. Their mission is simple but powerful: to facilitate seamless financial transactions for families across Latin America.

Initially launched as a platform to send, spend, save, and earn money using stablecoins, Coco Wallet has quickly established itself as a crucial player in the remittance space. As of now, they've facilitated an impressive $40 million in transfers, benefiting around 235,000 families. Their services include sending USDT on the Solana blockchain with a 2.5% fee, domiciliary cash delivery with a 5% fee, instant transfers between Coco accounts for free, and sending Bolívares to bank accounts in just 30 minutes at no extra cost.

But they aren’t stopping there. One of their exciting upcoming features will be an international Visa card that users can leverage for online and in-store purchases. This step represents yet another way Coco Wallet is enhancing the user experience in the realm of digital transactions.

In terms of reach, they ensure a rapid delivery time for coins and dollars, standing out in a market that often struggles with speed and efficiency. Add to this their clear emphasis on user-friendly service, and you can see why Coco Wallet has gathered a following among users looking for reliable financial solutions.

For more information, check out their website at [cocowallet.app](https://cocowallet.app) and join the growing number of users transforming how money moves across borders.
